alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 29 at 12:52PM EST until January 30 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Storm total snowfall of 6 to 14 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Near zero visibility at times. * WHERE...Central Interior Cumberland, Androscoggin and Kennebec Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snow banding will move over the area resulting in intense snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour as well as blowing and drifting snow. Wind chill values in the single digits to teens below zero.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For a more precise forecast for your specific location...go to www.weather.gov/gray..
